articles.title: Maine voters approve red flag gun law after mass shooting that killed 18
articles.description:
Maine Gov. Janet Mills, a Democrat, opposed the ballot question. She said in October that the yellow flag law was “carefully crafted” with Maine in mind, and it remains the right law for the state.

The post Maine voters approve red flag gun law after mass shooting that killed 18 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Maine voters approved a red flag gun law following a mass shooting that killed 18 people.
Governor Janet Mills opposed the ballot question, emphasizing the existing yellow flag law's suitability.
The new law may influence gun control discussions in neighboring Boston and surrounding areas.

articles.title: Bob Dylan accepts honorary doctorate from Berklee – just in time for tribute show
articles.description:
For the first time since 1970, Dylan has accepted an honorary doctorate from an American university — and it’s in Boston.

The post Bob Dylan accepts honorary doctorate from Berklee – just in time for tribute show appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bob Dylan received an honorary doctorate from Berklee College of Music on November 5, 2025.
This marks Dylan's first honorary degree from an American university since 1970.
The event coincides with a tribute show, enhancing Boston's cultural scene.

articles.title: Revolution reportedly set to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach
articles.description:
Mitrovic recently led the U.S. youth team to the quarterfinals at the U-20 World Cup.

The post Revolution reportedly set to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Revolution plans to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach for the upcoming season.
Mitrovic led the U.S. youth team to the quarterfinals at the U-20 World Cup.
Boston residents anticipate improved performance from the Revolution under new leadership.

articles.title: 6 dead in listeria outbreak linked to pasta
articles.description:
Health officials said that a total of 27 people in 18 states had been affected by the outbreak, and that they were working to investigate the source.

The post 6 dead in listeria outbreak linked to pasta appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Six people have died due to a listeria outbreak linked to pasta.
27 individuals across 18 states, including Massachusetts, have been affected.
Health officials are investigating the outbreak's source to prevent further cases.
